item.title: First Super Mario Galaxy Movie Trailer Reportedly Coming This Month
item.content:encoded:
The first full Super Mario Galaxy Movie trailer is reportedly coming later this month. In fact, it could be coming within the next few weeks.

According to MyTimeToShine, a movie outlet with accurate reports in the past, the next trailer for the upcoming movie is set to premiere in theaters ahead of Wicked For Good on November 21. Originally, plans seemed to call for it to debut in theaters before Zootopia 2, which launches on November 26.

In addition to its theatrical showing, the outlet adds that it should appear online beforehand.

“The trailer will drop online before November 21st, and then make its theatrical debut with Wicked For Good,” they said. “That releases a week before Zootopia 2. It could still play before Zootopia 2, but that won’t be its official cinema debut.”

Confirmed during September’s Nintendo Direct, the Super Mario Galaxy Movie is the sequel to the highly successful The Super Mario Bros. Movie from 2023. The sequel will see Chris Pratt return as Mario, along with Anya Taylor-Joy as Princess Peach, Charlie Day as Luigi, Keegan-Michael Key as Toad, Jack Black as Bowser, and Kevin Michael Richardson as Kamek.

The Super Mario Galaxy Movie is scheduled to release in theaters on April 3, 2026. Its release will mark exactly three years to the day of the original’s launch.

What are you hoping to see from the upcoming trailer for The Super Mario Galaxy Movie? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about EA quietly removing a “controversial” skin from Battlefield 6 and Battlefield REDSEC. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1599: Hints And Answer For November 4, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an easier Wordle answer than the past few days. Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1599 on November 4, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, November 4, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1599 is going to be a tougher puzzle for most players. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 5.2 guesses out of 6 to get. That means it’s a bit higher than the 4.8-guess average on November 3.

General Wordle Hints For November 4

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The word contains a repeated vowel.
  • Hint 2: It starts with a letter that often signals something a bit formal or official.
  • Hint 3: It’s a place where people gather for concerts, meetings, or performances.
  • Hint 4: You might buy tickets to get into one.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1599 for November 4, 2025

Starter Words For November 4, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • VENOM
  • NEVER
  • VAUNT

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1599 On November 4, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: VENUE

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1598 on November 3, 2025:

Answer: AWOKE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1597?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on November 5 will be Wordle Game #1600.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
